intro: Elatostema pinnativenium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf elatostema, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its simple, opposite, and often hairy leaves that are usually narrow and lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Elatostema pinnativenium is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species within the genus Elatostema.
